sentences.en: A friend exaggerate a man's virtue, and enemy his crime.
sentences.cn: 朋友溢美, 敌人扬恶.

sentences.en: Bob has a tendency to exaggerate things.
Celia said. " I realized I must always tell doctors the exact truth, and never exaggerate, never conceal. "
sentences.cn: “ 我还认识到,”西莉亚接着说,“必须永远对医生讲真话, 既不能夸大其辞, 也不能遮遮盖盖. ”

sentences.en: Don't exaggerate the difficulties of your work.
Don't exaggerate the parallelism between the two cases.
sentences.cn: 不要夸大那两件事的相似性.

sentences.en: He was fatally driven to exaggerate his discontentment.
sentences.cn: 这使他的不快无限膨胀.

sentences.en: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.cn: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

sentences.en: I think that you exaggerate, Pilar.
sentences.cn: 我认为你看得太严重了,比拉尔.

sentences.en: If you exaggerate, people will no longer believe you.
sentences.cn: 如果你说话虚夸, 人们便不会相信你了.

sentences.en: Most leaders'vanity causes them to exaggerate their own significance.
sentences.cn: 绝大多数领导人出于虚荣心往往喜欢夸大他们自己的重要地位.

sentences.en: Sheila admitted that she did sometimes exaggerate the demands of her job.
sentences.cn: 希拉承认自己有时候确实夸大了工作的难度。

sentences.en: There could be more unrest, but I wouldn't exaggerate the problems.
sentences.cn: 可能会有更大的动荡，不过我想也不必夸大问题。

sentences.en: These figures exaggerate the loss of competitiveness.
sentences.cn: 这些数字夸大了竞争力的丧失。

sentences.en: This chap likes to exaggerate and is good at nothing but boasting.
sentences.cn: 这个人言过其实,就会吹牛皮放大炮.

sentences.en: We can't exaggerate his scientific attainment.
sentences.cn: 我们无法估量他在科学上的造诣.

words.tran_cn: 夸张；夸大之词；夸张的手法

trans.tran_en: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is
